qas.question: On what date was Caesar killed?
Who comprised most of the members of the conspiracy to assassinate Caesar?
What did some members of the conspiracy believe Caesar would bring back?
Who did Gaius Cassius and Marcus Brutus lead the conspiracy against?
Why did many members of the senate flee the city after Caesar's death?

context: <a3_0>Caesar<a3_0/> was assassinated on <a0_0>March 15, 44 BC<a0_0/>. The assassination was led by Gaius Cassius and Marcus Brutus. Most of the conspirators were <a1_0>senators<a1_0/>, who had a variety of economic, political, or personal motivations for carrying out the assassination. Many were afraid that Caesar would soon resurrect <a2_0>the monarchy<a2_0/> and declare himself king. Others feared loss of property or prestige as Caesar carried out his land reforms in favor of the landless classes. Virtually all the conspirators fled the city after Caesar's death in <a4_0>fear of retaliation<a4_0/>. The civil war that followed destroyed what was left of the Republic.
